N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 340.8 - Denial of access to records

State Regulations
(a) Denial of access to records shall be in
writing, stating the reason or reasons therefor and advising the person making
the request of his right to appeal to the appeals officer, who shall be the
departmental general counsel. (b) Failure to provide records or to acknowledge receipt of a request therefor
within the time specified in section
340.6
(b) of this

Part shall be deemed a denial of access for purposes of section
340.9
of this Part; provided, however, that if the request is acknowledged or the records are provided prior
to the time an appeal is initiated, such a failure shall not be deemed a
denial. Notes
